definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: First, I cut an access hole in the Bridge Deck and glued the Wheelhouse to it.
sentences.chinese: 首先，我削减一进入洞，在桥面和胶合板舵手给它。

sentences.english: There was no better paddler , no better steersman than my brother.
sentences.chinese: 这世上再找不到比他更好的桨手和舵手了。

sentences.english: The cox should organize and encourage all oar men to work together.
sentences.chinese: 舵手必须组织和鼓励所有艇员同心协力进行比赛。

sentences.english: The cox steers the boat with a rudder and organize the tactics of the race.
sentences.chinese: 舵手用舵操纵船并在比赛中作战术指挥。

sentences.english: Without ideal as the lighthouse, even the best steersman will get lost.
sentences.chinese: 没有理想的灯塔，再好的舵手也会迷失航向。

sentences.english: Helmsman, follow Dr. Nichols' Calculations to the letter.
sentences.chinese: 舵手，按尼可斯博士计算的字母设置。

sentences.english: But the centurion believed the pilot and the master of the ship, more than those things which were said by Paul.
sentences.chinese: 可是，百夫长宁信从舵手和船主，不听保禄所说的话。

sentences.english: Women's Championships are restricted to female paddlers only except the steersman and drummer.
sentences.chinese: 女子锦标赛之划手必须由女士担任，舵手及鼓手除外。

sentences.english: The Coxswain Authority is especially, ironically evident in basketball.
sentences.chinese: 具有讽刺意味的是，“舵手权威”在篮球中尤其明显。

sentences.english: "He's no common man, Barbecue, " said the coxswain to me.
sentences.chinese: ‘大叉烧’，他是个不同寻常的人，”舵手对我说。

sentences.english: It is in a location under the Wheelhouse that has easy access for replacement.
sentences.chinese: 这是在一个位置下，舵手已方便更换。

sentences.english: My fireboat will be equipped with a remote TV camera in the Wheelhouse.
sentences.chinese: 我的灭火轮将配备一个遥控器在电视镜头舵手。

sentences.english: like a raft struggling in the middle of nowhere, I am searching for my steersman that belongs to me for good.
sentences.chinese: 像一只没有方向的小舟，在寻找着永远的舵手。

sentences.english: South China City Center Building, like a sail, a symbol of the winds and waves of the helmsman.
sentences.chinese: 华南城中心大厦，像个船帆，象征着乘风破浪的舵手。
那舵手把我们的船掉过头来。

sentences.english: Then he attaches it to the late Great Helmsman's corpulent , kneeling body.
sentences.chinese: 然后他附加到已故的伟大舵手的肥胖，跪机构。

definition: to hold the rudder/to hold (to take, to be at) the helm/to steer
to steer (a vessel)/to hold the rudder/at the helm
course/direction (a ship or plane is heading in)
